Why not

Although I agree with you, let me play devil's advocate: It costs a lot of money to offer student email accounts to everyone, especially if you're offering a lot of storage with it. This is a recurring cost for them every year, and since the number of students joining every year increases, it's a constantly almost exponentially increasing cost. Beyond a point, it becomes too much to handle. 

Unis will need to draw the line at some compromise. At my uni, we get 20 GB of storage on our uni email address. But it's lifetime access. So we get much less storage but it's always with us. The other compromise would've been to increase storage but have an expiry date. 

So yes while I agree that PES should give students email addresses, they also need to find a way to handle the costs for it.
